intro: Iresine aureoreticulata, commonly known as the golden nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves with a metallic sheen. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or red, clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive reticulate pattern, giving it its common name. Iresine aureoreticulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage.
